text: Ryan Anderson you said on the Heritage
Foundation website today that you found
both decisions disturbing can you take
us through each one starting with the
Defense of Marriage Act sure you know in
the Defense of Marriage Act the Supreme
Court said that the federal government
has to accept whatever the states say
about marriage even for federal policy
and for federal law but this
misunderstands federalism in our system
of government the states are sovereign
to define marriage for the purposes of
state policy state benefits state law
and the federal government sovereign to
define marriage for federal policies in
federal law for federal purposes and
what's surprising about this cuz at the
same time when they rolled in the
Defense of Marriage Act the states have
this right
they didn't uphold the right of the
Californian citizens who went to the
ballot box twice to pass a law defining
what marriages they voted twice on
marriage twice the citizens of
California said marriage is a unit of a
man and a woman but the Supreme Court
today said that the citizens didn't have
standing in cordless because the
governor of California and the Attorney
General refused to do their job their
job of defending California's law the
citizens were defending the law before
the Supreme Court and today the court
said you don't have standing someone on
your website wrote it and said isn't
this the ultimate conservative ruling
because it's leaving this leave leaving
people's lives to themselves and and
taking out the federal interference what
would you say to that well the reason
that governments in the marriage
business isn't because it cares about
the love life of consenting adults
governments not in the marriage business
because it cares about romance
governments in the marriage business
because there's a certain type of Union
the union of a man and a woman that can
produce new life and government wants to
make sure that that new life has a mom
and a dad and upholding the institution
of marriage is the least restrictive
least coercive way for the government to
make sure that children are raised by
the man and the woman the mother and the
father that create the children when
this doesn't happen that's when we've
seen government grow when marriages fall
apart when marriages and
take place in the first place single
parenting divorce and remarriage
cohabitation this is when the welfare
state grows it's when crime increases
it's when the prison population rises
it's when child poverty increases it's
when social mobility decreases so
everything you can care about if you
care about limited government and you
care about the poor if you care about
liberty and social justice is better
served by a healthy marriage culture now
you're 31 and a lot of our polls out
there showing that there's more support
for marriage equality among people in
your age group how is that affecting you
and your own friendships and
relationships sure look most of my
friends even the ones that disagree with
me they say this is a reasonable
disagreement that the marriage question
is something that people of sound mind
and goodwill can disagree about some of
my friends have you know reacted in a
way that's I think a little
inappropriate but that's fine the
majority say this is an important
conversation and we should have the
conversation the courts shouldn't cut
the conversation short
so let's continue discussing continue
voting and let's have citizens make
marriage policy finally where do you go
from here on the challenging challenges
yeah so the one nice thing about today's
ruling is that the court refused to
create a constitutional right to
same-sex marriage the court refused to
redefine marriage for the entire country
what that means is citizens in all 50
states can continue to discuss marriage
can continue to explain what marriage is
why marriage matters and what the
consequences are if we redefine marriage
and they can keep going to the ballot
box already today the governor of
Indiana said that he's going to support
a constitutional amendment to the state
constitution of Indiana that tells the
truth about marriage and hopefully
citizens in all 50 states will continue
speaking out boldly on what marriage is
thank you very much
sure thing
you
